verses.verse: I cried <WH6817> unto God <WH430> with my voice <WH6963>, even unto God <WH430> with my voice <WH6963>; and he gave ear unto me <WH238>.

In the day <WH3117> of my trouble <WH6869> I sought <WH1875> the Lord <WH136>: my hand <WH3027> stretched <WH5064> in the night <WH3915>, and ceased <WH6313> not <WH5315>: my soul refused <WH3985> to be comforted <WH5162>.
I remembered <WH2142> God <WH430>, and was troubled <WH1993>: I complained <WH7878>, and my spirit <WH7307> was overwhelmed <WH5848>. Selah <WH5542>.
You hold <WH270> my eyes <WH5869> open <WH8109>: I am so troubled <WH6470> that I cannot speak <WH1696>.
I have considered <WH2803> the days <WH3117> of old <WH6924>, the years <WH8141> of ancient times <WH5769>.
I call to memory <WH2142> my song <WH5058> in the night <WH3915>: I commune <WH7878> with my own heart <WH3824>: and my spirit <WH7307> made diligent search <WH2664>.
Will the Lord <WH136> cast off <WH2186> for ever <WH5769>? and will <WH3254> he be favorable no more <WH7521>?
Is his mercy <WH2617> clean gone <WH656> for ever <WH5331>? does his promise <WH562> fail <WH1584> for evermore <WH1755>?
Has God <WH410> forgotten <WH7911> to be gracious <WH2589>? has he in anger <WH639> shut up <WH7092> his tender mercies <WH7356>? Selah <WH5542>.
And I said <WH559>, This is my infirmity <WH2470>: but I will remember the years <WH8141> of the right hand <WH3225> of the most High <WH5945>.
I will remember <WH2142> the works <WH4611> of the Lord <WH3050>: surely I will remember <WH2142> your wonders <WH6382> of old <WH6924>.
I will meditate <WH1897> also of all your work <WH6467>, and talk <WH7878> of your doings <WH5949>.
Your way <WH1870>, O God <WH430>, is in the sanctuary <WH6944>: who is so great <WH1419> a God <WH410> as our God <WH430>?
You are the God <WH410> that does <WH6213> wonders <WH6382>: you have declared <WH3045> your strength <WH5797> among the people <WH5971>.
You have with your arm <WH2220> redeemed <WH1350> your people <WH5971>, the sons <WH1121> of Jacob <WH3290> and Joseph <WH3130>. Selah <WH5542>.
The waters <WH4325> saw <WH7200> you <WH430>, O God, the waters <WH4325> saw <WH7200> you <WH2342>; they were afraid: the depths <WH8415> also were troubled <WH7264>.
The clouds <WH5645> poured out <WH2229> water <WH4325>: the skies <WH7834> sent out <WH5414> a sound <WH6963>: your arrows <WH2687> also went abroad <WH1980>.
The voice <WH6963> of your thunder <WH7482> was in the heaven <WH1534>: the lightnings <WH1300> lightened <WH215> the world <WH8398>: the earth <WH776> trembled <WH7264> and shook <WH7493>.
Your way <WH1870> is in the sea <WH3220>, and your path <WH7635> in the great <WH7227> waters <WH4325>, and your footsteps <WH6119> are not known <WH3045>.
You led <WH5148> your people <WH5971> like a flock <WH6629> by the hand <WH3027> of Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175>.
